headline.main: PARIS GOSSIP.; Americans in Europe--Tourists on the Move--Places of Fashionable Summer Resort Rachel--Departure of the King of Bavaria--A New Explosive Ball--The sunken Ships at Sebastepel--Literary Intelligence.

docs.lead_paragraph: The period for the annual inundation of Ameri cans into Paris has arrived. Like fair weather birds, they only emigrate in the Spring. Compared to last year, the influx is more than doubled-but last year suffered from the reaction of the Exhibition. Soon these will be scattered over Europe--some sweltering through the scorching sun of Italy, to climb Vesuviusor the dome of St. Peter's;
docs.snippet: The period for the annual inundation of Ameri cans into Paris has arrived. Like fair weather birds, they only emigrate in the Spring. Compared to last year, the influx is more than doubled-but last year suffered from the reaction of the Exhibition....

docs.lead_paragraph: No news from the Court of Appeals nor any promise of the time when there will be any news. If we do not get the decision next week, the probabilities are that we shall have to wait until after the 4th of July, before we can know what is to be the fate of the Metropolitan Police.

docs.lead_paragraph: The largest yacht yet built in this country has been constructed for Mr. JOHN D. JOHNSON, of the New-York Yacht Club. She was built at Setauret, L. I., by JOSEPH HOWLAND, under the superintendance of Capt. THOS. B. HAWKING, of Part Jefferson; she is to be schooner rigged, and the sails will be made by R. H. WILSON, of Port Jefferson, who made the sails of the yacht America.

headline.main: A Word for the School Children.

docs.lead_paragraph: The French Empire is now upon its trial before the tribunal of the popular will. That the trial will not, and cannot be a fair and impartial trial, we need not say, Yet the arrangements which have been made for holding it go far towards determining us ;to believe that the verdict will after all be essentially a fair verdict--that it will reflect the dominant

docs.lead_paragraph: On Monday the Port Wardens included in their complaint for violations of the Port Warden law of 1857, Capt. SAMUEL CANDLER, another of the old Marine Surveyors, who was appointed in 1843 by the Chamber of Commerce and Board of Underwriters, and who has acted in that capacityever since.
